title-part.text: COOLING OR FREEZING APPARATUS NOT COVERED BY ANY OTHER SUBCLASS

reference.text: refrigerated show cases A47F3/04 ; thermally-insulated vessels for domestic use A47J41/00 ; refrigerated vehicles, see the appropriate subclasses of classes B60 to B64 ; containers with thermal insulation in general B65D81/38 ; heat-transfer, heat-exchange or heat-storage materials, e.g. refrigerants, or materials for the production of heat or cold by chemical reactions other than by combustion C09K5/00 ; thermally-insulated vessels for liquefied or solidified gases F17C ; air-conditioning or air-humidification F24F ; refrigeration machines, plants or systems F25B ; cooling of instruments and comparable apparatus without refrigeration G12B ; cooling of engines or pumps, see the relevant classes

note.note-paragraph:
In this subclass, the following term is used with the meaning indicated:
- "device" means an enclosed space to be cooled; such
devices being associated either with refrigerating
machinery, e.g. in a refrigerator, or with other cold
sources, e.g. in an ice-box.
Attention is drawn to Note (2) following the title of subclass F24F .

title-part.text: Devices not associated with refrigerating machinery
Devices using naturally cold air or cold water
using naturally cold water, e.g. household tap water
portable, i.e. adapted to be carried personally
using liquefied gases, e.g. liquid air

CPC-specific-text.text: portable, i.e. adapted to be carried personally

title-part.text: with conveyers carrying articles to be cooled through the cooling space
using solidified gases, e.g. carbon-dioxide snow

CPC-specific-text.text: Stationary devices with conveyers carrying articles to be cooled through the cooling space

title-part.text: portable, i.e. adapted to be carried personally
Devices using endothermic chemical reactions, e.g. using frigorific mixtures
portable, i.e. adapted to be carried personally
Devices using evaporation effects without recovery of the vapour

reference.text: butter or cheese dishes with cooling devices A47G19/26

title-part.text: Devices not covered by groups F25D1/00 to F25D7/00
Combinations of devices covered by two or more of the groups F25D1/00 to F25D7/00
Self-contained movable devices, e.g. domestic refrigerator
with cooling compartments at different temperatures

CPC-specific-text.text: using primary and secondary refrigeration systems

title-part.text: specially adapted for storing deep-frozen articles
with several cooling compartments, e.g. refrigerated locker systems
the compartments being at different temperatures
with conveyers carrying articles to be cooled through the cooling space

CPC-specific-text.text: Articles being submerged in liquid coolant
with circulation of gaseous cooling fluid

title-part.text: Devices not covered by group F25D11/00 or F25D13/00 , e.g. non-self-contained movable devices
Devices using a combination of a cooling mode associated with refrigerating machinery with a cooling mode not associated with refrigerating machinery
Details or features of the devices covered by groups F25D1/00 to F25D16/00
Arrangements for circulating gas, e.g. air, within refrigerated spaces
for circulating air, e.g. by convection

CPC-specific-text.text: Air treating means within refrigerated spaces

title-part.text: Arrangement or mounting of refrigeration units with respect to devices

CPC-specific-text.text: or objects to be refrigerated, e.g. infra-red detectors

title-part.text: with more than one refrigeration unit

reference.text: removing ice or water from heat-exchange apparatus in general F28F17/00 ; heating arrangements specially adapted for transparent or reflecting areas H05B3/84

title-part.text: Detecting the presence of frost or condensate
Preventing the formation of frost or condensate
by hot-fluid circulating system separate from the refrigerant system

CPC-specific-text.text: the hot fluid being ambient air

title-part.text: Collecting or removing condensed and defrost water
with special compartments, e.g. butter conditioners

reference.text: F25D23/08 takes precedence; containers with thermal insulation B65D81/38

CPC-specific-text.text: formed by an assembly of panels
formed by moulding, e.g. moulding in situ
Arrangements for circulating fluids through the insulating material

title-part.text: Parts formed wholly or mainly of plastics materials

note.note-paragraph: When a document describes both breaking and sealing strips it is classified in group F25D23/082 only.

title-part.text: Arrangements for mounting in particular locations, e.g. for built-in type, for corner type
Arrangements of compartments additional to cooling compartments
Combinations of refrigerators with other equipment, e.g. stove
Charging, supporting, and discharging the articles to be cooled
Arrangement or mounting of control or safety devices

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for cooling receptacles, e.g. tanks

title-part.text: Special arrangements or features for refrigerators
Cooling or freezing apparatus not covered by any other subclass
Devices using cold storage material, i.e. ice or other freezable liquid
using ice cubes or crushed ice
disposed in a cold storage element not forming part of a container for products to be cooled , e.g. ice pack or gel accumulator
the element placed in a compartment which can be opened without the need of opening the container itself
Fasteners or fixing means for the element
having the shape of an ice cube
using cold storage material disposed in closed wall forming part of a container for products to be cooled
the liquid is disposed in the space between the walls of the container
the liquid is disposed in an accumulator pack locked in a closable wall forming part of the container
Position of the cold storage material in relationship to a product to be cooled
external to the container for a beverage, e.g. a bottle, can, drinking glass or pitcher
inside the beverage contained in a bottle, can, drinking glass, pitcher or dispenser
on the side of the product
around the neck of a bottle
Treating air flowing to refrigeration compartments
by creating a vacuum in a storage compartment
the fans not of the axial type
the fans allowing rotation in reverse direction
using condenser heat or heat of desuperheaters
using heat from electric elements or using an electric field for enhancing removal
characterised by means to fix, clamp, or connect water pipes or evaporation trays
characterised by the construction of drip water collection pans
characterised by the pipes or pipe connections
characterised by capillary, wick, adsorbent, or evaporation elements
Control of the air flow cooling refrigerating machinery
Filters in the air flow cooling refrigerating machinery
characterised by the incoming air flow
the fans not of the axial type
the fans allowing rotation in reverse direction
Details of doors or covers not otherwise covered
Doors that can be pivoted either left-handed or right-handed
Details of walls not otherwise covered
the refrigerator is characterised by a water filter for the water/ice dispenser
the refrigerator is characterised by a water tank for the water/ice dispenser
Shelves made of glass or ceramic
Lighting arrangements on the external side of the refrigerator, freezer or cooling box
to be carried on the back of a person
General features of, or devices for refrigerators, cold rooms, ice-boxes, or for cooling or freezing apparatus not covered by any other subclass
Carts specially adapted for transporting objects to be cooled
Refrigerating devices for cooling wearing apparel, e.g. garments, hats, shoes or gloves.
Removal, transportation or shipping of refrigerating devices from one location to another
Refrigerating devices characterised by electrical wiring
Controlling according to a predetermined profile
Sensors detecting the presence of a person
Sensors detecting the presence of a product
Sensors measuring the temperature of the evaporator
more than one sensor measuring the inside air temperature in a compartment
Sensors measuring the temperature outside the refrigerator or freezer
Sensors measuring the temperature of products
